IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR ADULTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS
IRS990.MissionDescription: AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR ADULTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS
IRS990.Description: DEVELOPMENT OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING FOR PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS THROUGH NEW CONSTRUCTION AND REHABILITATION OF EXISTING BUILDINGS. ASSIST LIMITED PARTNERSHIPS IN ACQUISITION OF LAND AND BUILDINGS. ASSET MANAGEMENT OF PROPERTIES ONCE DEVELOPMENT IS COMPLETED.

Activity2.Description: PROVISION OF SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR TENANTS LIVING IN THE affordable HOUSING THAT HAS BEEN DEVELOPED.

NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: RENAE S DEMENT CPA DIROF FInance

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: BOOK/TAX DIFFERENCE - LOSS FROM INVESTMENT IN PARTNERSHIP: -1523.
BOOK/TAX DIFFERENCE - LOSS FROM INVESTMENT IN PARTNERSHIP: -1523.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. AFTER THE AUDIT COMMITEE REVIEWS THE DRAFT form 990, IT IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: board members complete an annual conflict of interest disclosure form. the form is reviewed and filed by the ceo. the form is utilized to monitor potential conflicts throughout the year. additionally when matters come before the board of directors that have a potential for a conflict of interest, the board president and/or ceo asks whether any board member has a conflict or potential conflict. any potential conflicts are discussed , and any board member with a conflict recuses themself from the discussion and vote.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: INFORMATION REGARDING SALARIES OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OR THE EQUIVALENT FROM OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IS COMPILED BY THE DIRECTOR OF ADMINISTRATION and provided to the board of directors ANNUALLY. THE INFORMATION IS OBTAINED FROM THE FORM 990 OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS, DIRECT INQUIRIES OF OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND /OR VARIOUS LOCAL NON-PROFIT COMPENSATION SURVEYS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS USES THE INFORMATION TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE SALARY, AND ANY CONTEMPLATED INCREASES, ARE APPROPRIATE. similar information is compiled for management staff and provided to the ceo annually . the ceo uses the information to determine appropriate levels of compensation for key staff. the board of directors sees the management staff information every two to three years.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY REQUEST.
